info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:54PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lake, northern Kane, southeastern McHenry, DuPage and northern Cook Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 853 PM CDT, Doppler radar was scattered strong thunderstorms across the central and northern Chicago metro. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chicago, Aurora, Naperville, Elgin, Waukegan, Cicero, Arlington Heights, Evanston, Schaumburg, Palatine, Skokie, Des Plaines, Berwyn, Mount Prospect, Wheaton, Hoffman Estates, Oak Park, Downers Grove, Glenview and Elmhurst. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for north central and northeastern Illinois.
